org.azeckoski.reflectutils
Class ConversionUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.azeckoski.reflectutils.ConversionUtils

public class ConversionUtils
extends Object

Class which provides methods for converting between object types, can be extended with various converters

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com)

setVariableConverters

public void setVariableConverters(List<VariableConverter> variableConverters)
Replace the current or default variable converters with a new set, this will remove the default variable converters and will not add them back in

Parameters:
variableConverters - the variable object converters

clearVariableConverters

public void clearVariableConverters()
Resets and removes all variable converters including the defaults, use this when you want to override the existing variable converters

convertToString

public String convertToString(Object object)
Added for apache commons beanutils compatibility, you should probably use convert(Object, Class)
Convert the specified value into a String. If the specified value is an array, the first element (converted to a String) will be returned. The registered Converter for the java.lang.String class will be used, which allows applications to customize Object->String conversions (the default implementation simply uses toString()).

Parameters:
object - any object
Returns:
the string OR null if one cannot be found

convertString

public Object convertString(String value,
                            Class<?> type)
Added for apache commons beanutils compatibility, you should probably use convert(Object, Class)
Convert the string value to an object of the specified class (if possible). Otherwise, return a String representation of the value.

Parameters:
value - the string value to be converted
type - any class type that you want to try to convert the object to
Returns:
the converted value
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the conversion cannot be completed

convert

public <T> T convert(Object value,
                     Class<T> type)
Converts an object to any other object if possible using the current set of converters, will allow nulls to pass through unless there is a converter which will handle them
Includes special handling for primitives, arrays, and collections (will take the first value when converting to scalar)

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
value - any object
type - any class type that you want to try to convert the object to
Returns:
the converted value (allows null to pass through except in the case of primitives which become the primitive default)
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the conversion cannot be completed

convertWithConverter

protected <T> T convertWithConverter(Object value,
                                     Class<T> type)
Use the converters to convert the value to the provided type, this simply finds the converter and does the conversion, will convert interface types automatically
WARNING: you should use convert(Object, Class) unless you have a special need for this, it is primarily for reducing code complexity

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
value - any object to be converted
type - the type to convert to
Returns:
the converted object (may be null)
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - is the conversion could not be completed

getConverterOrFail

protected <T> Converter<T> getConverterOrFail(Class<T> type)
Get the converter or throw exception

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
type - type to convert to
Returns:
the converter or die
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the converter cannot be found

getConverter

protected <T> Converter<T> getConverter(Class<T> type)
Get the converter for the given type if there is one

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
type - the type to convert to
Returns:
the converter for this type OR null if there is not one

getVariableConverter

protected VariableConverter getVariableConverter(Object value,
                                                 Class<?> type)
Get the variable converter for this value and type if there is one, returns null if no converter is available

Parameters:
value - the value to convert
type - the type to convert to
Returns:
the variable converter if there is one OR null if none exists
